intro: Hieracium dunkelii, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are heart-shaped and serrated. Its flowers are yellow, forming dense clusters at the top of the stem, and it thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is often found in areas with rich, loamy soil and partial to full sunlight.
